text: I’m building a custom workflow action and keep getting an error when I try to run contacts through to test it. The event details for the error is in the screenshot below. What does this error mean and how do I fix it? It seems to be preventing a request from even being sent to the “actionUrl” I have defined.

Similar topic for me. Is anyone able to help out a rookie with the custom-code actions in workflows? This is my first time working with Operations Hub Pro, and am not a developer.
I've tried working through HubSpot's available docs to implement the Contact Deduplication, but am not having any luck.
If there is a more helpful guide that you are aware of, or I would also be happy to pay someone to handle this/walk me through it on a call.
<@U01QVR44MEY> I've read several of your comments & threads on similar items. Are you aware of any resources that are helpful for people starting out with this?
yeah, man, I would suggest using a workflow template for this. Should be one for deduping by contact phone number
If you're having some trouble with that though, you can drop a description of what you're trying to do and I'll shoot you over some info on how to build it

Thanks :raised_hands: - didn't know the workflow template existed in HubSpot. I was able to bring that in & get it working. When setting up the Private App for this - what scopes are actually needed to run this?

We are also looking to implement this for deduplicating companies (mess created by a different private app). Would you recommend running both through the same app for contact deduplication, or is it better to have a separate one in place for Companies?
<@U05CNABKUJ1> There is a Use Case Library of templates (just in case you hadn’t seen it yet). <https://www.HubSpot.com/programmable-automation-use-cases>
For company you'll want the scopes companies.read and companies.write
You'll definitely need an entirely different custom coded action for deduping companies, it will follow a similar logic though

Anyone know how I can confirm if a Custom Code action is actually being sent from HubSpot? Since Custom Code is serverless, it constantly rotates IP addresses and we need a way to whitelist a specific IP address, or something else, so HubSpot can access our internal API. If there something sent in the header I think it would work, but I don't see a non webhook way of doing that
but since you’re executing the call to your api, you can put whatever you want in the header
